actor_awards.notes: Griffith won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for 'Ben-Hur' (1959). He received a second Oscar nomination for 'Tom Jones' (1963).

filmography.title: Ben-Hur
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, eccentric Arab sheik who befriends Judah Ben-Hur and provides him with the magnificent white horses for the chariot race.
filmography.plot: A Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, but he regains his freedom and returns for revenge.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor; BAFTA: Nominated – Best British Actor

filmography.title: Tom Jones
filmography.role_description: A boisterous, hard-drinking country squire who is the father of Sophie, Tom Jones's love interest, and represents the earthy, chaotic nature of the era.
filmography.plot: The romantic and bawdy adventures of an adopted foundling in 18th-century England.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor; BAFTA: Nominated – Best British Actor

filmography.title: Oliver!
filmography.role_description: A drunken, incoherent judge who presides over Oliver's trial for pickpocketing with comically erratic authority.
filmography.plot: A young orphan boy runs away from a workhouse and falls in with a group of pickpockets led by the elderly Fagin.
filmography.awards: Film won 6 Oscars including Best Picture

filmography.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
filmography.role_description: A rough, loyal seaman on the HMS Bounty who becomes one of the mutineers against the tyrannical Captain Bligh.
filmography.plot: The crew of a British naval vessel mutinies against their harsh captain and settles on a remote island.

filmography.title: How to Steal a Million
filmography.role_description: A legendary art forger who gleefully copies masterpieces in his attic while posing as a respectable collector.
filmography.plot: A woman who must steal a statue from a Paris museum to help conceal her father's art forgeries recruits a burglar to help her.
filmography.awards: Writers Guild of America: Nominated – Best Written American Comedy

filmography.title: Exodus
filmography.role_description: A Greek-Cypriot businessman and sympathetic ally who aids the Jewish refugees in their struggle to reach Palestine.
filmography.plot: The state of Israel is created in 1948, leading to war with its Arab neighbors.

filmography.title: The Abominable Dr. Phibes
filmography.role_description: A wise religious scholar who is consulted by the police to help understand the biblical plagues being used as murder methods.
filmography.plot: A doctor, scientist, organist, and biblical scholar inspires a series of murders based on the ten plagues of Egypt.

filmography.title: Dr. Phibes Rises Again
filmography.role_description: A fellow archaeologist and rival who meets a bizarre demise (bottled as a ship in a bottle) at the hands of the vengeful doctor.
filmography.plot: The vengeful Dr. Phibes rises from his suspended animation to seek the Scroll of Life in Egypt to resurrect his wife.

filmography.title: Start the Revolution Without Me
filmography.role_description: A bumbling, oblivious monarch who is more concerned with his elaborate costumes than the brewing French Revolution.
filmography.plot: Two sets of identical twins are mismatched at birth; one pair becomes aristocrats, the other peasants, and they cross paths on the eve of the French Revolution.

filmography.title: Wuthering Heights
filmography.role_description: The local doctor who tends to the Earnshaw family and witnesses the tragic decline of Cathy.
filmography.plot: A story of the passionate and destructive love between the intense Heathcliff and the free-spirited Catherine Earnshaw.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Original Score

filmography.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt
filmography.role_description: A local poacher and rascal who is recruited to be the fireman for a village's vintage steam train.
filmography.plot: Residents of a village form a committee to run their own railway line after the government decides to close it.

filmography.title: Kind Hearts and Coronets
filmography.role_description: The presiding official at the trial of Louis Mazzini in the House of Lords.
filmography.plot: A distant poor relative of the Duke of D'Ascoyne plots to inherit the title by murdering the eight other heirs who stand ahead of him in the line of succession.

filmography.title: The Canterbury Tales
filmography.role_description: An elderly, lustful knight in Pier Paolo Pasolini's adaptation of Chaucer, who marries a young wife with disastrous consequences.
filmography.plot: A collection of eight stories adapted from Geoffrey Chaucer's poems, filled with earthy humor and bawdy situations.
filmography.awards: Berlin International Film Festival: Win – Golden Bear

filmography.title: Lucky Jim
filmography.role_description: An absent-minded, catastrophe-prone history professor who is the bane of the protagonist Jim Dixon's existence.
filmography.plot: A junior history lecturer at a provincial university tries to keep his job while dealing with a disastrous boss and a chaotic love life.

filmography.title: The Fixer
filmography.role_description: An anti-Semitic, alcoholic Russian merchant whose daughter accuses the Jewish protagonist of a crime.
filmography.plot: In Tsarist Russia, a Jewish handyman is wrongly imprisoned for a ritual murder he did not commit and refuses to confess despite torture.

filmography.title: The Counterfeit Traitor
filmography.role_description: A cynical, tough-minded British intelligence agent who coerces an American oilman into spying on the Nazis.
filmography.plot: An American-born Swedish oil merchant is blackmailed by the Allies into spying on the Nazis during World War II.

filmography.title: Cry of the Banshee
filmography.role_description: A gravedigger and town character who gets caught up in the vengeance of a witch against a cruel magistrate.
filmography.plot: A witch summons a sidhe to kill the family of a sadistic magistrate who has been hunting her coven.

filmography.title: Whoever Slew Auntie Roo?
filmography.role_description: An eccentric local butcher who supplies the demented 'Auntie Roo' and unwittingly plays a part in her macabre household.
filmography.plot: A demented widow lures children into her mansion for her annual Christmas party, but two orphans suspect she is a witch.

filmography.title: The Bargee
filmography.role_description: An old-fashioned canal lock keeper whose daughter becomes the romantic target of a womanizing bargee.
filmography.plot: A womanizing barge captain on the British canals has to juggle his many girlfriends while dealing with a lock keeper's daughter.

filmography.title: So Evil My Love
filmography.role_description: An official who presides over an inquest in this dark Victorian thriller.
filmography.plot: A missionary's widow falls for a charming artist who drags her into a life of crime, blackmail, and murder.

filmography.title: Laughter in Paradise
filmography.role_description: A mischievous practical joker whose will forces his heirs to perform embarrassing tasks to inherit his fortune.
filmography.plot: Four relatives of a wealthy practical joker must perform tasks completely against their nature to inherit his money.

filmography.title: The Passover Plot
filmography.role_description: The Jewish high priest who is involved in the political and religious conspiracy surrounding Jesus.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the controversial theory that Jesus planned his own crucifixion and resurrection to fulfill prophecy.

filmography.title: A Run for Your Money
filmography.role_description: A harpist and traditional Welsh singer whom the main characters encounter in London.
filmography.plot: Two Welsh coal miners win a contest and travel to London for a rugby match, encountering various misadventures.

filmography.title: The Last Remake of Beau Geste
filmography.role_description: A comedic judge presiding over a trial in this spoof of the classic Foreign Legion tale.
filmography.plot: A parody of the classic film 'Beau Geste', following the misadventures of the Geste brothers in the French Foreign Legion.

filmography.title: Grand Slam
filmography.role_description: A mournful undertaker and rugby fan who travels to Paris for a match, finding adventure and memories of his youth.
filmography.plot: Four members of a Welsh rugby club travel to Paris to watch Wales play France, leading to comic escapades.

filmography.title: The Sleeping Tiger
filmography.role_description: A police inspector who investigates a young criminal staying with a psychiatrist.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist invites a criminal into his home as a 'guinea pig' for rehabilitation, but the criminal begins an affair with the doctor's wife.
